summary: This is an email chain from May 2019 regarding the transfer of FBI Florida's Epstein case files to the Southern District of New York (SDNY) for copying as part of their investigation. The correspondence reveals internal FBI coordination and a decision not to provide the entire file directly to SDNY for copying.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the SDNY's open investigation, for which the FBI Florida case files are being requested.

events.title: SDNY Requests Epstein Files from FBI Florida
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney from SDNY formally requests that FBI Florida ship all case files related to the investigations of Jeffrey Epstein and a related individual to the U.S. Attorney's Office for copying.

events.title: FBI-MM Ships Files, Sets Review Parameters
events.description: An FBI official confirms the files are being shipped but states the entirety of the file will not be turned over to SDNY for them to copy directly, indicating a controlled review process.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) had an open investigation into Jeffrey Epstein as of May 2019, working in partnership with FBI New York.
SDNY requested the complete case files from a prior FBI Florida investigation into Epstein and a related individual for copying to ensure discovery compliance.
The requested files included official case files and several boxes of agent work-product.
An FBI official indicated they would not allow SDNY to take possession of the entire file to make a copy, stating 'That is just not how it works,' implying a more controlled review process.
The document references a related investigation of another individual (name redacted in the text), indicating the Epstein case files were intertwined with another matter.
